name: French trans-dev
tagline: Machine-corrected French translations of Greek and Latin works.
body:
#Welcome to french_trans-dev!

##About
This repository contains machine-corrected French translations of public-domain Greek and Latin works.

These XML files were produced by data entry company [Digital Divide Data](http://www.digitaldividedata.com), who OCR'd, corrected and encoded the texts in accordance with the latest [EpiDoc](http://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/wiki/Home/) standards. While adequate, more can and should be done to improve the XML (the -dev(elopment) suffix indicates the repository is open to improvement).

##Contents

###Latin
* Marcus Aurelius. _[Les Pensées de Marc-Aurèle](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/marcusAurelius_1921.xml)_, Translated by Aimé-Prosper Lemercier (1921) Paris: Librairie Félix Alcan.

###Ancient Greek
* Aristophanes. _[Comédies, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/aristophanes_1_1830.xml)_, Traduit par Nicolas Louis Marie Artaud (1830) Paris: Brissot-Thivars.
* Aristophanes. _[Comédies, vol. 3](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/aristophanes_3_1830.xml)_, Traduit par Nicolas Louis Marie Artaud (1830) Paris: Brissot-Thivars. 
* Aristophanes. _[Comédies, vol. 5](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/aristophanes_5_1830.xml)_, Traduit par Nicolas Louis Marie Artaud (1830) Paris: Brissot-Thivars.
* Homer. _[Odyssée](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/homer_1866.xml)_, Traduit par Émile Pessonneaux (1866) Paris: Charpentier.
* Longus. _[Daphnis et Chloé](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/longus_1884.xml)_, Traduit par Marie Charles Zévort (1884) Paris: Charpentier.
* Quintus Smyrnaeus. _[Guerre de Troie, vol. 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/french_trans-dev/blob/master/quintusSmyrnaeus_1_1800.xml)_, Traduit par R. Tourlet (1800) Paris: Chez-Lesguilliez.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
